definition: to waste/to spend/to consume/to squander/news/(coll.) to delay/to dilly-dally
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: In fact, in the daytime, live plants will consume carbon dioxide.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，在白天裏，水中植物也將會耗損二氧化碳。

sentences.english: Arguing about details consumed many hours of the committee's valuable time.
sentences.chinese: 爭論細節題目耗損了委員會數小時珍貴的時間。

sentences.english: This loss upon loss has left me feeling sad and brittle and about seven thousand years old.
sentences.chinese: 這雙重耗損使我感到悲傷脆弱，覺得自己像七千歲。

sentences.english: Corrosion Wearing away due to chemical reactions, mainly oxidation.
sentences.chinese: 因化學反應而耗損，以氧化作用爲主。

sentences.english: Those small factories are also lavish consumer and waster of raw materials.
sentences.chinese: 場還在潑天的耗損和華侈原質料。

sentences.english: The actual oil molecules never wear out.
sentences.chinese: 事實上油分子是不會耗損的。

sentences.english: The governing equation is a two-dimensional wave equation which includes the effects of topographical variation and energy dissipation.
sentences.chinese: 控制方程爲含地形變化和能量耗損的二維波動方程。

definition: fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
variant of 紓壓|纾压[shu1 ya1]
to accumulate over a long period of time
